_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:00:52 using v2.2
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: The total number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over each year, with peaks in Quarter 4; a sign a hospital is dealing with winter pressures. Over successive years, however, there has been a slight increase in the number of cancelled elective operations of around 850 extra cancelled operations per year (between 1994/95 and 2013/14). Figures from the latest quarter suggest that there are over 15,000 operation cancelled per quarter from a total of nearly two million elective operations performed, meaning only a small proportion of operations are cancelled.
